thread.title: JT backing Fifita to fire in All Stars clash
thread.title_full: JT backing Fifita to fire in All Stars clash

title: JT backing Fifita to fire in All Stars clash
text:
All Star game could expand 1:54 Sharks forward Andrew Fifita has his ‘mojo’ back, says Johnathan Thurston February 10, 2017 9:45am Source: The Daily Telegraph ANDREW Fifita has his “mojo” back. 
That is the word from Indigenous All Stars teammate Johnathan Thurston on one of the game’s most polarising figures as the controversial Sharks prop prepares to end his representative exile against the World All Stars in Newcastle on Friday night. 
Denied the Clive Churchill medal following Cronulla’s drought breaking 2016 grand final triumph and a Kangaroos jumper because of his public show of support for one-punch killer Kieran Loveridge last season, Fifita threatened to walk away from rugby league. 
But it seems the controversy, which also cost him a $20,000 fine from the NRL, is behind him. 
Thurston, who will co-skipper a star-studded Indigenous squad alongside Greg Inglis, is confident a slimmed down Fifita, who has been off-limits to the media in the build-up to the game, is ready to rip and tear into the World All Stars pack at McDonald Jones Stadium. 
WEIGHT LOSS: Slim Kas skewered the kebabs Andrew Fifita during an All Stars team photo at the Pullman hotel in Sydney. Picture: Brett Costello Source: News Corp Australia 
“He’s got a spring in his step when he is walking around in camp and he has trained pretty well in the two sessions we’ve had,” Thurston said. 
“He’s a big personality. You can hear him from anywhere and it’s like he has certainly got his mojo back. 
“He’ll be in for a big one.” 
Indigenous All Stars coach Laurie Daley says if looks are anything to go by, Fifita is in for a big season. 
“I don’t think there is any issue with Andrew,” Daley said. 
“He actually looks in really good shape. I think he has lost a lot of weight and trained really hard in the off-season and if that’s an indicator, I think he will have a big year. 
“He seems to be as good as gold and I think he’ll have a big game tomorrow [Friday] night. I think he is pretty keen to get out there and play well against a big All Stars team.” 
Fifita came under fire last August after The Daily Telegraph revealed he had written the initials F. K. L (For Kieran Loveridge) on his wrist bands in at least seven NRL games. 
Loveridge, a childhood friend, is serving a 10 year jail term for the one-punch attack that led to Thomas Kelly’s death in 2012. 
Fifita was hit in the hip pocket in late December by the NRL after an Integrity Unit investigation dragged on for almost four months and prior to that, was denied the chance to earn $50,000 from playing in the Four Nations tournament after being ruled ineligible. All Stars captains Jake Friend and Johnathan Thurston pose for photos. Source: AAP 
The Indigenous All Stars will go into the annual clash, which is being played outside of Queensland for the first time, a raging hot favourite against a World side that has been hampered by injury pullouts and without the firepower of their opposition. 
Daley said the concept needed to remain on the NRL calendar. 
“It’s a great way for us to kickstart the season and a great way for rugby league to showcase the inclusive nature of our sport,” he said. 
“There have been so many Indigenous players that have played our game in over 100 years. It’s a fantastic team. The guys are excited to go out there and throw the ball around and I think you will see an open, entertaining game. 
“It’s obviously different to State of Origin and different to club footy but it’s great that all the boys can get a feel for one another and they go out there and just play. I’m really excited about some of the younger boys. 
“It’s good the boys all want to play in it.” 
World All Stars coach Mal Meninga said his side has a big part to play. 
“The game is the culmination of a celebration of Indigenous participation in our sport so it’s an enjoyable time. It’s a fun time, there is a lot of freedom around how we want to play so they will just go out there and do their best and entertain the crowd.” View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily.
